conclusion: Equation for \(v^2\) as a function of displacement \(x\) is \(v^2 = u^2 + 2ax\).
Graph shows \(v^2\) on the y-axis and \(x\) on the x-axis.
Slope of the line in the graph corresponds to \(2a\).
Car A and Car B have different initial velocities and accelerations.
Line for Car A has a steeper slope than the line for Car B.
A steeper slope indicates a larger value of \(2a\), meaning greater acceleration.
Since the slope of Car A's line is greater than that of Car B, Car A has a greater acceleration.
